name: 楊士萱
objective: This course aims to let students be familiar with some advanced mathematics tools frequently employed in their disciplines. Topics include complex numbers, advanced linear algebra, differential equations, and linear systems.
schedule:
Week 01: Course Description
Week 02: Real Numbers and Complex Numbers
Week 03: Vectors and Matrices
Week 04: Determinants / Systems of Linear Equations
Week 05: Linear Transformations
Week 06: Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors (I)
Week 07: Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors (II)
Week 08: Summary of Linear Algebra / Quiz 1
Week 09: Classification of Differential Equations / First-Order Linear Differential Equations
Week 10: Higher-Order Constant-Coefficient Linear Differential Equations, Homogeneous Solutions
Week 11: Higher-Order Constant-Coefficient Linear Differential Equations, Particular Solutions
Week 12: Summary of Differential Equations / Quiz 2
Week 13: Definition of Laplace Transforms
Week 14: Partial fractions and Inverse Laplace Transforms
Week 15: Applications of Laplace Transforms to Differential Equations
Week 16: Applications of Laplace Transforms to Linear Systems
Week 17: Course Review
Week 18: Final Exam
scorePolicy:
1. Attendence and in-class recitations, 25%.
2. Written assignments, 20%.
3. Two 50-minute Quizzes, 30% (15% each).
4. 80-minute comprehensive Final Exam, 25%.
materials:
Textbook:
Advanced Engineering Mathematics with MATLAB by T. L. Harman, J. Dabney, and N. Richert, 2nd edition, Brooks/Cole Thomson, 2000. （高立圖書代理）
Reference:
Advanced Engineering Mathematics by P. V. O’Neil, Thomson, 2007.
